attributes.action: Impeach Boris Johnson and Micheal Gove for lying during the referendum campaign
attributes.background: The claim that £350 million pounds a week went to the EU and would be used instead to fund the NHS was a major factor in influencing voters. Since 24th June the admissions that this would not be the case and never would be, amount to premeditated lies and misleading enticement of voters.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept a petition calling for impeachment because this procedure is now considered obsolete. It is not therefore clear what action could be taken on this petition. 
 
This note explains the history of impeachment and the current position: 

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/CBP-7612
